qas.question: Two of the most developed economic organizations under the Ottoman Empire were what?
What were the scribes of the chancery known as?
Part of the scribal bureaucracy were trained what?
What did the scribal bureaucracy become?
The Ottoman Empire had the most developed economic organizations among Islamic Governments until which century?

context: The organization of <a0_0>the treasury and chancery<a0_0/> were developed under the Ottoman Empire more than any other Islamic government and, until <a4_0>the 17th century<a4_0/>, they were the leading organization among all their contemporaries. This organization developed a scribal bureaucracy (known as "<a1_0>men of the pen<a1_0/>") as a distinct group, partly highly trained <a2_0>ulama<a2_0/>, which developed into <a3_0>a professional body<a3_0/>. The effectiveness of this professional financial body stands behind the success of many great Ottoman statesmen.
